meanings.definition: A factor that causes stress or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: The upcoming exams are major stressors for the students.
meanings.sent2: Work deadlines can be significant stressors in the office environment.
meanings.sent3: The noisy neighbors are stressors for the peace-loving couple.
meanings.sent4: Financial problems can act as stressors, weighing heavily on one's mind.
meanings.sent5: The constant barking of the dog next door became a relentless stressor for the family.

meanings.definition: Something that puts pressure on a person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The heavy workload became one of the main stressors for the employees.
meanings.sent2: Carrying heavy bags can be physical stressors on the body.
meanings.sent3: The leaky roof was an unexpected stressor during the rainy season.
meanings.sent4: The tight deadline acted as a stressor, pushing the team to work efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The crowded room created a claustrophobic stressor for the introverted individual.
